page.title: 07TOURISM / LEISURE- AERO PARK
page.content: The Aero Park and Flambards Victorian Village opened in 1976.Commander Hale, an ex_Navy man, started it all.There is a display of aircraft some of which you can climb inside and a mock_up of the Concorde cabin.The Victorian Village shows old houses,shops,a school and toys.The "Britain in the Blitz" display shows what life was like in World War II.There are new things being added all the time like the old fashioned Fire engine.Other attractions are the Bumper Boats and Ball Pool.The most exciting feature is the SR2 Simulator. You sit in a cabin which moves while film of Tobagganing, Car Racing, Rollercoaster and Flying are shown in front of you.You feel as though you are really involved.Many children in our school often visit the Aero Park and think it is a great day out.
